body:
**Bug Template**

*Title*: Envoy doesn't output valid prometheus metrics

*Description*:
>What issue is being seen? Describe what should be happening instead of
the bug, for example: Envoy should not crash, the expected value isn't
returned, etc.

Envoy should produce valid prometheus metrics. Specifically, it should group all metrics of the same type into a single block (which it currently does not).

From the prometheus spec [here](https://github.com/prometheus/docs/blob/master/content/docs/instrumenting/exposition_formats.md): `All lines for a given metric must be provided as one single group, with the optional HELP and TYPE lines first (in no particular order). Beyond that, reproducible sorting in repeated expositions is preferred but not required, i.e. do not sort if the computational cost is prohibitive.`

See an example in the repro steps.

*Repro steps*:
> Include sample requests, environment, etc. All data and inputs
required to reproduce the bug.

Configure multiple upstreams and then curl your envoy proxy's prometheus endpoint.

Here is an example prometheus endpoint query of one of my envoy proxies below. As an example, look at the `envoy_cluster_upstream_cx_rx_bytes_total metric`. This is preventing us from reliably monitoring envoy. (Note that we're running this with Istio):
